designations.source: A review of the Hemiptera of Great Britain: The shieldbugs and allied families
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national status of shield bugs using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Coreoidea, Pentatomoidea & Pyrrhocoroidea in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Nationally Scarce, Nationally Rare and Other Species
designations.designation: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
designations.designation_description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Includes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.
designations.comments: Historically always rare and mainly restricted to the breckland area of Suffolk and Norfolk. Not recorded between 1964 and 2010, but since discovered in 2011 in Cambridgeshire and  West Suffolk, although the habitat is no longer suitable at the latter site and recent searches for the bug have proved negative.

designations.designation_description: A taxon is Critically Endangered when it is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in the immediate future, as defined by any of the criteria A to E.
